review_emp_txt: Some franchise owners dock hours. Pros Good discounts on the food. Cons The location where I was working, in North Fresno near Riverpark Mall, was ran by the owner s father who treated the female staff with contempt and derision. Would yell at the staff, in front of the guests, if they didn t exactly follow his formula for making the sandwiches (even when the staff were trying to fulfill the special requests of the guests). He would clock out the closers (with or without their knowledge) before they were done with their tasks, and ask employees to stay an hour or two past the end of their shift, but would not pay them for their time.

review_emp_txt: Bushs chicken..more writeups then checks Pros Paid weekly. Nice visor If you have another job they ll work with your schedule Cons This is for belton 1 near the hs. Stuck on counter and drink duty..no tips because customers are too cheap. Carhops are paid way more. I signed up for that but it was only given to veterans. Unrealistic expectations for closing on time. As front of house, you clean the restaurant part, the bathrooms and are still expected to serve customers until 9 00pm..it gets dirty again just silly. Some unrealistic time for getting your duty done and yet u still get wrote up. Why even clean well You might as well work half butt. Most of my writeups were for this. How does 1 person do everything for the front while the carhops get to work more as a team at closing time. Little odd how they run it. I worked at sonic and was only given 1 write up in 8 months and not for cleaning up at the end..just amateur. Here 6 in 2 months. Too many chiefs not enough Indians. I HIGHLY don t recommend working if you re considered cheap labor like I was. Got hired somewhere else knowing I was gonna be fired eventually. There is literally no business in the restaurant only outside. They re looking for the cheapest labor but they are the quickest to be written up. Other restaurants truly value their lowest paid workers. Beware do not work here!

review_emp_txt: Great family oriented workforce Pros Understanding, flexible, with friendly staff. We do more charity work than i have ever seen before at any other employer I have worked for. Community based and for our own employees. Great employment advancement opportunities with jobs being offered internally first and educational reimbursement plan. Cons low pay compared to area and can be a little unorganized and lack current times technology and methods of business. Simple email, accounting, and other processes within the company feel as if it s still 1970 s. Healthcare benefits are VERY expensive. Most employees struggle to afford them, unless you are a provider or Doctor.

review_emp_txt: Family owned means that you, the outsider, will be disrespected, at best. Pros It s a paycheck. Sundays dark ( family day ). Holidays are regularly given off. Cons Owner feels it is his right to dock your tips for any small transgression. A mistake by one employee means punishment for the whole team. Salaried managers (i.e., owner s adult children), bussers, dishwashers, and cooks not to mention the waitstaff all sharing in the paltry tip pool.

review_emp_txt: Great group of people to work for!! Pros Dockside Seafood was my first job years ago. The Carbone family are all amazing people and provide everyone there with a means to learn the value of hard work. I can t speak highly enough of them. I didn t mind working hard for them because they genuinely appreciated it. Sometimes days could get a little overwhelming during crawfish season, but at the end of the day, you definitely feel accomplished. It s very apparent that they truly appreciate the people that work for them. Thats the biggest Pro any job can have. Anytime I stop by to pick up a po boy or some boiled shrimp, they always treat me like family. I can t say that for any other job that I ve ever had since then. What I think I liked best about the job was the sense that we were really a team. Everybody came together and worked as efficiently as possible. If you aren t a team player or a hard worker this gig probably isn t for you. If you are, however, I can assure you that this will be a rewarding experience. I made a lot of lifelong friends working here. Some of my best memories come from this place. Besides that, the food is great. In my years of employment there, I don t think I ever got tired of testing the crawfish, shrimp, snowcrabs, dungeoness, etc. Cons If you work in the back of the restaurant you ll probably smell like shrimp at the end of the night. Comes with the territory.

review_emp_txt: I m a server working at a restaurant where management cares about nothing but profits Pros Well the only plus I can think of is that it is a job, and as an employee you get free tap water. Cons They do not hire hosts, bussers, dishwashers or anyone to handle to go orders. Yep as a server in between helping tables you wash have to go wash dishes otherwise your guests won t have clean dishes for their meals. Servers wash every single dish including dishes cooks used for prepping or food storage. You are only allowed to drink tap water. I never recieved an orientation going over company rules or polices, never filled out a W4 or I9 when hired. I recieved maybe 20 minutes of training in total with a full restaurant my trainer did her best within those 20 minutes but was incredibly busy (only her and one other server working at the time). On my first day I was scolded several times because I failed to do things I was never shown how to do. The manager sits in office staring at a video feed of the restaurant so she can yell at you if you do anything wrong, despite the fact that you were never told how to do things properly the yelling you recieve doesn t even how to do things the correct way. If you ring in an order wrong or there is an error you as the server are responsible to pay out of your pocket to correct the error. They also have found a loophole in California law so that the company pays you under the minimum wage (California law states servers are supposed to make minimum wage unlike some other states). I ve had some employers that treated me unfairly and I can t speak for all Buffalo Wings Rings locations but this location in Modesto California treats employees worse than any other employer I ve worked for. Looking for new job that knows how to treat employees like humans. Also kitchen, prep area, walk in and freezer are kept extremely dirty. A majority of the time the restaurants food handling procedures would fail a health inspection (ex. Prepping raw chicken right next to dirty dishes and trash on the same table within a foot or two of each other). They also never asked if I had a food handlers card (needed for all employees handling food)

review_emp_txt: PAFCO Pros This is a medium sized company that offers two big advantages over larger, well known companies (1) immediate hands on experience and responsibility and (2) immediate recognition, promotions and bonuses, if you do your job well. Cons Look, it s a food manufacturer, distributor, processor. So, it s a hands on tough business. If you want to make 15 18 hr working in a nice office at a local bank, then that s definitely an option. But, if you want an opportunity to rise quickly in a company that rewards hard work and gives you every opportunity to take responsibility in various roles, then this is the company that allows you to do just that. A con is that it s a family run operation no true corporate titles and structure. But,, the benefit is that if you put in the effort, they ll take care of you just like family.

review_emp_txt: Bushs chicken..more writeups then checks Pros Paid weekly. Nice visor If you have another job they ll work with your schedule Cons This is for belton 1 near the hs. Stuck on counter and drink duty..no tips because customers are too cheap. Carhops are paid way more. I signed up for that but it was only given to veterans. Unrealistic expectations for closing on time. As front of house, you clean the restaurant part, the bathrooms and are still expected to serve customers until 9 00pm..it gets dirty again just silly. Some unrealistic time for getting your duty done and yet u still get wrote up. Why even clean well You might as well work half butt. Most of my writeups were for this. How does 1 person do everything for the front while the carhops get to work more as a team at closing time. Little odd how they run it. I worked at sonic and was only given 1 write up in 8 months and not for cleaning up at the end..just amateur. Here 6 in 2 months. Too many chiefs not enough Indians. I HIGHLY don t recommend working if you re considered cheap labor like I was. Got hired somewhere else knowing I was gonna be fired eventually. There is literally no business in the restaurant only outside. They re looking for the cheapest labor but they are the quickest to be written up. Other restaurants truly value their lowest paid workers. Beware do not work here!

review_emp_txt: Barista Pros Great people, good for networking when you see regulars, free drinks when working, atmosphere can be amazing with the right people, if not then boring. Great for college students for a quick part time job. Management is great if taught and manage by the right people. Cons Working with a lot of college students can cause drama which can change the work environment. Hours can be long at time, long period of standing up, cleaning often can be tiredsome, and bare minimal of growth.

review_emp_txt: Great Place to Work Pros I have worked at Pizza Luce for about 5 years. The best thing about this place is the people. The staff support each other in ways that reflect a family. The culture allows you to be yourself in ways that other places don t, but you should expect to work hard. You will learn how strong you are and how to push yourself. At the end of the day you know that you contributed in a unique way that will positively effect the business. It is also nice to sell a good product. Most of the food is locally sourced high quality ingredients. Cons The late and early hours can be difficult to handle sometimes.

review_emp_txt: The epitome of Chicago s windy politics. Pros One of the most influential PACs in the state, the ultimate pro to working at Personal PAC is seeing the results. Personal PAC has done so much for women s and reproductive rights in Illinois. Cons This organization is ran by a person who does not know how manage staff. When an issue or problem arises, his lack of managerial skills is manifested as extreme hostility and manipulation. There is no HR person to bring these issues to light or prevent retaliation, and the Board turns a blind eye if an issue is brought to them. His autocratic leadership leaves no room for upward mobility or growth, creates a hostile work environment, and has led to an extremely high turnover rate (three people in eight months it s a three person office).

review_emp_txt: Some franchise owners dock hours. Pros Good discounts on the food. Cons The location where I was working, in North Fresno near Riverpark Mall, was ran by the owner s father who treated the female staff with contempt and derision. Would yell at the staff, in front of the guests, if they didn t exactly follow his formula for making the sandwiches (even when the staff were trying to fulfill the special requests of the guests). He would clock out the closers (with or without their knowledge) before they were done with their tasks, and ask employees to stay an hour or two past the end of their shift, but would not pay them for their time.

review_emp_txt: Amazing Food! Amazing Staff! Hours are terrible Pros Free meal with every shift, friendly supportive co workers. Excellent training provided for new store opening. review_emp_txt: I have a fun time at work, and everybody is very supportive. Pros Schedule works around you Friendly environment between staff and management Good amount of pay tips for the work you do Helps form a more personal relationship among staff and management Workload is not overbearing and boring Cons As a cashier, we are responsible for finding other cashiers to cover for our shift if we want it off. Some customers who call in to order food to go are very rude, but for the sake of good customer service, we still have to accommodate to their needs most of the time.

review_emp_txt: Great Place to Work Pros I have worked at Pizza Luce for about 5 years. The best thing about this place is the people. The staff support each other in ways that reflect a family. The culture allows you to be yourself in ways that other places don t, but you should expect to work hard. You will learn how strong you are and how to push yourself. At the end of the day you know that you contributed in a unique way that will positively effect the business. It is also nice to sell a good product. Most of the food is locally sourced high quality ingredients. Cons The late and early hours can be difficult to handle sometimes.

review_emp_txt: The worst possible place to ever work Pros The tips are decent.. That s about it Cons You will be worked like a space, yelled at, and sworn at by managers for not being fast enough (they want you to be the freaking flash), not to mention you don t get to keep your own tips you have to share them with all the other servers, and not only that but the managers are greedy and will steal a great majority of your tips, they have no consideration for their employees, they make you buy their ugly shirts, you can t even go to the restroom, you never leave at the hour you re supposed to leave, they give you a ten minute break in which your supposed to scarf down your food, and did I mention that at the end of the week they take out so much stuff (I never understood how), but you only get a 20 check!! 20!! Yes, your paycheck is 20!! If you re lucky.. Majority of the time it s under that amount!! One girl even got a 0 check!! You heard me right. She worked her behind off and her check was 0!! Supposedly we make too much in tips so they take away the great majority of our tips. This place is a joke. Save yourself the trouble and don t bother working there.

review_emp_txt: Good place to learn how to be a middle class restaurant server Pros a. Fast Paced, job is fun and keeps you on your feet. Good training b. Middle class guests decent to good tip, gets you prepped for bigger places c. Laid back management, when I worked, we weren t micromanaged d. Responsibilities, servers had to make drinks, bus, among other things you re mostly going to have something to do e. Managers are flexible, willing to work with your schedule and strengths f. Easy to get shifts covered Cons a. Fast Paced, not good for someone who can t keep up b. Very little teamwork, the particular location I was at, everyone was out for themselves c. Few incentives to work harder d. Responsibilities for people who want a casual, easy place to work, this place might be a bit too much e. Culture and values of restaurant are great, but aren t enforced nor respected by coworkers

review_emp_txt: Being a Fudge Packer Pros If you love fudge, there s your reason for working here. (You can sample now and then, everything we make). Love the work teams, coworkers are all very friendly and easy going, and the company revolves around giving the customers a great experience. The work schedule is more flexible than in any other job. Cons If you can t handle annoying people or have very bad social communication skills this job won t fit you. Also, you probably won t get very much days off the weekend because that s when business is the busiest. Also you gotta be open to trying new things.

review_emp_txt: Great Place to Work Pros I have worked at Pizza Luce for about 5 years. The best thing about this place is the people. The staff support each other in ways that reflect a family. The culture allows you to be yourself in ways that other places don t, but you should expect to work hard. You will learn how strong you are and how to push yourself. At the end of the day you know that you contributed in a unique way that will positively effect the business. It is also nice to sell a good product. Most of the food is locally sourced high quality ingredients. Cons The late and early hours can be difficult to handle sometimes.

review_emp_txt: Iffy Pros Truly made me break out of my shell and become a more outgoing person. Great way to build up a network of people and new opportunities for different jobs. Most of the girls were a blast to work with I made lasting friendships with them. Tips are always a bonus. Cons Not being able to get any new tattoos or color my hair. (Even though there s girls hired with sleeves and huge pieces on their sides thighs). Always have to be Stage Ready , or they ll tell you to make yourself look better.. Constantly being asked to work doubles in order to cover girls that would frequently call off. Being scheduled doubles constantly because the turn around rate is so high there were hardly enough girls. The outfits felt a little sleezy after awhile. Even when I felt uncomfortable around certain guests that would come in, I was told to suck it up. ( These guests would make very crude comments it s very hard for me to find something inappropriate). On off seasons in the serving industry which means not a lot of pay sometimes.

review_emp_txt: Associate Pros Casual atmosphere, decent tips. Only really busy during the summer. Lots of regular customers. Works well with a college or high school schedule, the store closes early in the day so you will still have time for school work even if you close everyday. Cons Manager is rarely there, and you will not receive any formal training for the job. You will work mostly alone and if there are any issues with customers or problems with equipment you will have to figure it out on your own or hope that the manager picks up when you call. Very little support from any of your coworkers or manager. The schedule is posted sometimes the day that it takes effect and you will have to go into the store to see it or it will be sent to you via text message.

review_emp_txt: A Culinary Art Experience Pros Training, management invests in their employees knowledge Management team is very professional and supportive, most back office upstairs management moved up from front back of house. Staff are inviting, fun and energetic. Weekly outings occur birthday celebrations, basketball tournaments, BBQ s and even camping trips since i ve been with the company. Family meal is superb. Fresh dessert is made daily from our pastries chefs. We feel loved! Other stuff that makes Alexander s one of a kind We have an international intern program so be prepared to meet culinary artists from around the world. We partner with a local non profit that allows at risk youth to learn basic restaurant skills with us. Great for mentoring on the job! To reiterate, if you re looking for a career in Culinary Arts, enjoy working in a fast paced environment and are bright, come join the team! Cons Expectation, management expects you to know information outside of your job description. Management stresses when our investors or regional managers step through the front door although everything is always fine.

review_emp_txt: AMAZING place to work! Pros This place not only changes the customers lives that come through the door, but the workers as well. If you ask anyone that works for this company how they like working there, you will most likely see their eyes light up, i certainly am one of them. This is by far the best job anyone can have weather its your first job or your sixth. Simply put it is an absolute privilege to be a part of this company. I have grown professionally and personally due to the care of both the owners and the management. This company is the real deal and has high expectations, consider yourself lucky if you get this job! Cons Being part of a company that is growing at such a rapid rate can sometimes be stressful, but thats a good problem to have!

Cons Micro management, Micro management, Micro management. Very little freedom. Owners have questionable morals. review_emp_txt: Great money, management poor Pros Its great money, but you have to tip out almost half your tips to the kitchen. I worked here for almost a year and I would work 12 to 18 hour shifts with no break, plus If i made 500 tips, you tip out about 200. It s impossible to make more than 250 a night. Cons The manager doesnt make you feel important youre just replaceable. Plus if your a girl, prepare to dress in short skirts. They pushed all their greatest employees out because they made us all feel like we arent valued.

review_emp_txt: One of the worst jobs ever. Pros Friendly co workers Discount on food Easy to get hired Cons Management is terrible. They are rude and inconsiderate. There is always a lack of supplies. If you re a cashier, you get the worst end of this job. You get yelled at by unsatisfied customers for the mistakes of the cooks. The management doesn t care about you at all. Management doesn t report injuries, then tells you to Stop over exaggerating. Harassment is unavoidable in this job, upper management will not care and yell at you ANYWHERE.

review_emp_txt: Laid Back Family Feel Pros Working for Stuft Pizza was an overall positive experience for a part time job while in school. The management changes a lot, but while I worked there the management was always good to us. I made a lot of friends, it seemed more like play than work. Cons With the management changing a lot, lower status employees lost jobs. Not always consistent, a lot of complaints from customers.

review_emp_txt: Great place Pros It is a good place to work at. My coworkers and manager were friendly and willing to help. My manager was always willing to change the schedule for any appointments or emergencies. There was a great atmosphere in the work environment that I really enjoyed. Cons It can get rather busy on weekends and holidays.
